results.title: Respiration in man
results.brief_description: Living tissue and various instruments, techniques and experiments are used to illustrate the structure of the lungs. Movements of alveoli and blood in the vessels, gas concentration relationship, transport of 02 and C02, aortic and carotid bodies, and the function of carotid bodies are also shown. No other credits available.

results.title: Respecting differences (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Government and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties that migrant children have in adjusting to Australian schools and culture, especially non-English speaking children. Recently the New South Wales Government has given funds to support the teaching of ethnic languages in many state schools which helps facilitate adjustment to Australian life.

results.title: Respect for property
results.brief_description: A gang of boys break into a rival group’s club house and destroy much of the contents. Instead of seeking revenge, the boys who suffered the damage seek the help of a local policeman who explains to them the meaning of private and public property. They relate their own loss to the damage they have done on school property and realise that public property is owned by everyone and not just one individual.

results.title: Resources in its crust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
The major useful organic and mineral substances found in the earth’s crust. Classifies the resources as the metallic minerals, the non-metallic minerals, and the mineral fuels. How some of them are extracted and processed. Steps necessary to conserve irreplaceable resources.

results.title: Resources discovered
results.creator_credit: Walter F. Broome and Beechdale Educational Films
results.brief_description: The services which the public library can provide for industry and commerce. How in particular the smaller concern which cannot afford its own special library can through the public library have access to all the information resources of the nation. The way in which the librarian deals with the specific enquiries of different kinds it shown.

results.title: Resistance: Fall of Man
results.brief_description: In an alternate 1951, Sgt. Nathan Hale is among a unit of US soldiers sent to aid the British military against invading aliens, known as Chimera. When Hale’s unit is completely wiped out in a surprise attack, he struggles for survival.

constellations_other.name: Religion, cinema and censorship
constellations_other.description: Religious narratives and themes have a complicated relationship with censorship, with creators pushing the boundaries for better or worse.

results.title: Resistance and the 'High School Walkouts Against Racism'
results.creator_credit: Markus Strazds, Misha Lamb and Davina Rimmer
results.brief_description: The aims of resistance are to bring about a socially equal, democratic and ecologically sustainable socialist world and to organise, educate and mobilise young people to this end. Resistance, a Melbourne based organisation, was involved in organising high school students in protesting against One Nation and the racism this political party espoused and supported. This student movement was called “High School Walkouts Against Racism” and spread nationally with students participating in protest rallies outside the Queensland Parliament against Pauline Hanson and her One Nation Party. This short documentary presents personal views and commentary by two Resistance members, Andy and Liz along with actual footage of some of the protest rallies against racism. Soundtrack: Propagandhi and M.Y.C.
